alert.note: Alert for Breathitt (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 8:15AM EDT until July 29 at 7:41AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Kentucky... North Fork Kentucky River at Jackson affecting Breathitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Fork Kentucky River at Jackson. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 37.0 feet, Traffic stopped on left side of bridge on KY 30 and 52. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 30.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM EDT Thursday was 30.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 37.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight to 24.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will rise to 25.6 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 37.2 feet on 03/13/1963. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued at noon today.
